description:
Ripping, roofing, digging, breaking, smashing, burying, bending, burning... Farmers are sure destructive! Plan is to roof dads house, break and bury up some old concrete, and rebuild the big bud drawbar... Let's see how much we can get done!

A few years back we were introduced into some great ice fishing in our area. After a season of fishing in tents we decided to construct our own 4 man rigid tip up ice house out of an old boat trailer and some lumber. It can be -30f outside and 60f inside with castle of an ice house. Life has gotten busy and we don't make it to the ice as often as we would like. Reeling in some gorgeous trout in clear water is something everyone should experience!

It was a wild ride but like all harvest it eventually comes to an end. Harvest 2019 is in the books and will go down as the biggest we've ever had. Praise God for the bountiful harvest and injury free operation. So the question is...will harvest 2020 be bigger?

What a monster of a grainvac! We are truly amazed at the capacity of this Rem. The time it takes to clean a be floor is cut in half. Overall farming is off to a good start in 2020, lots of work left to do before we can take a breather but much getting done. Crops look great and rain has been very timely! 

More information on the VR12 here: https://www.aggrowth.com/en-us/brands/rem/grainvac-vr12

Not the 844! We are pretty bummed to see some of the most expensive parts of this machine destroyed. Thankfully we tracked down some pumps off a parts 844 loader and if all works out we should be able to get this beast running again. It is amazing how much you miss a machine when it is no longer usable. Here is the original repower video! https://youtu.be/SyvGyA0gvlI

Our Flexicoil(CASE IH) air carts are nearly 15 years old and fertilizer has taken its toll. These carts use pressurized metering systems, any air leaks can cause irregularities in seeding rate. Ours are flush with holes and needed to be rebuilt or replaced. Red Engineering not only showed us there is a stainless steel option but came out to help with the tedious install. Here we go! 

And yes the Red in RedE is because of the twin brothers red hair 😂👌. If you need air cart repairs check them out here. 
https://rede-ag.com/products/stainless-steel-air-cart-solutions/

Running 3 combines has greatly improved our harvesting capability. Rolling through 70+ acres/hr has been a lot of fun. Nothing makes harvest so spectacular than a massive lightning storm a few miles away. 

Beastbine crazy bright lights are Thomas HP4 and HP5 LEDs: 
- https://www.larsenlights.com/hp-4-oval

Special thanks to AgriCover for setting us up with,
Roltec Electric Tarp Conversion: 
- https://www.agricover.com/rolltarps/roltec/
&
Roltec Electric Hopper Conversion:
-https://www.agricover.com/rolltarps/roltecelectrichopperopener/

- https://www.demco-products.com/trailers/grain-trailers/aluminum-grain-trailer/

Check out Frielings equipment here: 
- http://www.frielingagequipment.com/

Beastbine's massive tires are Titan LSW 1400:
- https://www.titan-intl.com/TiresVsTracks

Our Flexicoil(CASE IH) Air Carts are nearly 15 years old and fertilizer has taken its toll. These carts used pressurized metering systems so any air leaks can cause irregularities in seeding rates. Ours were flush with holes and needed to be rebuilt or replaced. Red Engineering not only showed us there is a stainless steel option but came out to help with the tedious install. Here we go! 

And yes the Red in RedE is because of the twin brothers red hair 😂👌. If you need air cart repairs check them out here. 
https://rede-ag.com/products/stainless-steel-air-cart-solutions/

As days grow shorter and warm days fewer, we try to make a point each year to prepare equipment/tools for the long winter ahead. Being that there isn't a lot of farm work, we use this time to do the things that we couldn't get to over the summer months.
